DataElement.preferredName: Patient Kaposi Sarcoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether the patient has a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Kaposi Sarcoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has Kaposis sarcom
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Kaposis sarcoma, is KS impacting physical and/or psychological wellbeing and not amenable to local therapy and one or more of the following: Stable KS by despite 6 or more cycles of liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, anthracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Progressive disease despite 3 or more cycles of liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, antracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Patient who has received a cumulative lifetime dose of anthracyline of greater than or equal to 550 mg/m2; or Recurrent or progressive KS after completion of prior first line chemotherapy; Intolerant of or refuse further cytotoxic chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Kaposis sarcoma (following prior KS-specific therapy, Cohrots 1-3), is KS impacting physical and/or psychological wellbeing and not amenable to local therapy and one or more of the following:  Stable KS by despite 6 or more cycles of liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, anthracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Progressive disease despite 3 or more cycles of liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, anthracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Patient who has received a cumulative lifetime dose of anthracycline of  greater than or equal to 550 mg/m2; or Recurrent or progressive KS after completion of prior first line chemotherapy, or Intolerant of or refuses further cytotoxic chemotherapy; no KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease in past 5 years;  and the following laboratory values which supersede the values in section 3.1.6:  platelet count greater than lower limit of normal and hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Kaposi sarcoma impairing physical wellbeing (for example, tumor edema, pain, skin ulceration or breakdown, oral disease impairing function), no active KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease in past 12 months, and one or more of the following: Inadequate tumor response after 6 or more cycles of liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, anthracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Progressive disease while receiving liposomal doxorubicin or paclitaxel or other active cytotoxic agents (i.e. etoposide, bleomycin, anthracyclines, vincristine, vinblastine); or Intolerant of liposomal doxorubicin and paclitaxel?
